feed.title: Some real-world results about the current Segwit Discount

entry.title: Some real-world results about the current Segwit Discount
entry.summary: In a conversation between Gregory Maxwell and Matt Corallo, they discussed the idea of artificially limiting themselves to changing the parameters of Segwit, believing that a consensual hard fork in the current state would have a greater chance of acceptance if it changes the minimum number of lines of code. The conversation is brief, with a playful exchange between the two at the end.
